content:
Hi, I need help with finding a better name for docs#AlternatingMap.uncurryFin. As @Patrick Massot noted in #29957,

  • this function does something besides "uncurrying", namely it alternates over some permutations to ensure that the result is an alternating form;
  • it is not an inverse to docs#AlternatingMap.curryLeft

This means that the name uncurryFin could be misleading.
Something with make or mk to suggest it's creating a new object rather than just bundling it up?
Should uncurryFin be redefined to assume that the map is already alternating?
Right now it seems to be combined with a little bit of docs#MultilinearMap.alternatization

Eric Wieser said:

Should uncurryFin be redefined to assume that the map is already alternating?

I don't need these components at the moment, so I won't have time to work on this splitting of the function in two steps. If someone else does it, then I can review the pr.
In your application is the function already alternating?
No. My application is #29985, where I use this function to define the exterior derivative of a differential form and to prove d^2=0.
